review: I purchased the FireTV as a replacement for my parents AppleTV. Even though the AppleTV interface is supposed to be somewhat intuitive, it just never clicked with them. They picked up the FireTV interface almost immediately and have apparently been using it every single day since. The only problem they've had the interface is the differentiation between free Prime videos and regular videos (which even I have problems with sometimes).

review: Ordered this as my new bedroom streaming device when my old Xbox 360 finally pulled the trigger and ended it's miserable life.  Setup was ridiculously easy.  Plug and go.  Quad-core processor makes this device snappy and quick.  Streaming quality is excellent and goes between episodes in a snap.  Also, this product has access to TONS of popular mobile games via the Amazon Marketplace. Highly impressed with the quality of this product.  My only complaint is the lack of a manual sleep feature.  This product have no on/off button, and can only hibernate after a set amount of "idle time."  Normally, that is fine.  But if your television turns off (via sleep timer) before Fire TV does, Fire TV will NEVER enter sleep mode.  You have to turn your TV back on, hit the Home button, then the idle timer will begin.  It's a mild inconvenience, and by no means takes away from the experience of this machine.  I would recommend this to any friend.  I've used both Apple TV and Fire TV.  This far surpasses Apple TV, in my opinion, both in speed and quality.
